[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Department Management System (DMS) defines requirements for managing departments, office locations, and managerial assignments.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DMS supports department creation, office allocation, headquarters designation, manager assignments, and restructuring.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DMS integrates with HR databases and office systems for real-time updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DMS provides dashboards for department setup, office assignments, and manager tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DMS supports computing devices and authentication terminals.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DMS uses PostgreSQL, REST APIs, linking with HR and payroll systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: DMS secures data via OAuth 2.0, JWT, and HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DMS optimizes storage for department and office data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: DMS is configurable for multiple offices with role-based access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DMS integrates with cloud/on-premise deployments, linking with HR systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DMS manages departments, office allocations, headquarters, and manager assignments.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DMS serves HR personnel, department managers, and admins.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: DMS requires internet for real-time updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DMS relies on HR records, office data, and system integration.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with HR databases to retrieve employee details (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with office systems to validate office assignments (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow admins to create departments and assign offices (REQ-DB-001, REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall designate a headquarters per department (REQ-DB-001, REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall assign managers, tracking promotions and changes (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a UI for department and office management.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update departments, managers, and offices within 2s.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store department details, office locations, and manager records.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique IDs for departments, offices, and managers.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with HR policies and data regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log department, office, and managerial changes for audits (REQ-DB-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests department creation, office assignments, headquarters designation, manager allocation, and restructuring.
[SEC] 5. References: Company HR policies and office management guidelines.
